title: Leaked secret documents detail up to four additional Chinese spy balloons
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | One balloon flew over a U.S. carrier strike group in the Pacific, and another circumnavigated the globe with sophisticated surveillance technology.

title: Sons of ‘El Chapo’ hit with fentanyl charges; victims fed to tigers, U.S. alleges
description: The Justice Department charges the "Chapitos" -- leaders of the Sinaloa cartel -- with sending deadly fentanyl into the United States.

title: Mexico's president vows to eliminate national news agency
description: Mexico’s president says he will shut down Notimex, a national news agency that has been locked in a years-long strike against the woman he appointed to run it

title: Ancient Mayan ballgame marker unearthed at Chichén Itzá
description: An ancient stone marker used in a soccer-like ballgame was unearthed this week at the Chichén Itzá archaeological site in Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula.

title: Brazil judge orders police to question Bolsonaro on uprising
description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice has ordered the country’s federal police to take testimony from former President Jair Bolsonaro as part of the investigation into the Jan. 8 attacks on government buildings in the capital

title: Criticized over response to war, Swiss offer $2B for Ukraine
description: Switzerland says it will spend about $2 billion to help Ukraine with humanitarian and development assistance over the next six years, ponying up financial aid for Ukraine as Western critics press Bern to do more to help it defend itself against Russian invaders and squeeze Russian interests

title: Navalny, jailed Russian opposition figure, is severely ill, aides say
description: Alexei Navalny, a leading Russian opposition figure, is suffering from a mysterious stomach ailment and may have been poisoned, his press secretary said.

title: Pakistan arrests woman for claiming to be Islam's prophet
description: Pakistani police say they have arrested a Muslim woman in the country’s eastern Punjab province on blasphemy charges for allegedly claiming to be an Islamic prophet

title: Putin signs bill allowing electronic conscription notices
description: Russian President Putin has signed a bill allowing authorities to issue electronic notices to draftees and reservists amid the fighting in Ukraine

title: Bridge collapse in Kashmir kills girl, injures at least 70
description: Authorities in Indian-controlled Kashmir say an overcrowded footbridge collapsed into a rocky river, injuring at least 70 people and killing a 10-year-old girl

title: Papal official rejects new claims in 'Vatican Girl' mystery
description: The Vatican is pushing back hard against insinuations against St. John Paul II that were aired following the reopening of an investigation into the 1983 disappearance of the daughter of a Vatican employee

title: Finland's Moscow embassy receives powder-laden mail
description: Finland’s embassy in Moscow says it received an envelope containing white powder

title: Some UK nurses end strikes but others vow more walkouts
description: A British nursing union has rejected a pay offer from the government, dashing hopes of a quick end to a months-long wave of public-sector strikes that has disrupted schools, hospitals and services

title: What to know about Arcturus, a new coronavirus subvariant the WHO is tracking
description: India has returned to mask mandates in some areas after rising coronavirus cases linked to a new variant called Arcturus, or XBB.1.16.

title: Hezbollah chief: Israel didn't hit Hamas in Lebanon strikes
description: The leader of Lebanon’s militant Hezbollah group claims that Israel did not hit Hamas or Hezbollah targets in last week’s strikes on southern Lebanon

title: Austrians tried for allegedly helping Mossad shield Syrian
description: A trial has opened in Vienna of five former Austrian officials who are accused of harbouring and protecting a suspected Syrian war criminal in Austria at the request of Israel’s Mossad intelligence agency

title: France's Macron tours Notre Dame Cathedral reconstruction
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has toured the reconstruction works at Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris

title: Brazil’s Lula is latest world leader to visit Beijing, marks closer China ties
description: The Brazilian president is in Beijing, bolstering Chinese leader Xi Jinping's effort to set up a multipolar world that diminishes the United States' primacy.

title: Saudi Arabia mends ties with Syria as part of regional diplomatic spree
description: Saudi Arabia’s diplomatic push could reshape regional dynamics, analysts say, at a time of uncertainty about the future of U.S. engagement in the Middle East.

title: Pakistani police: 3 children killed while playing with bomb
description: Pakistani police say three children were killed while playing with an unexploded bomb at an abandoned house in the country’s southwest, near the Afghan border

title: Russian forces bear down on Ukrainian defenders in Bakhmut
description: Analysts and Russian officials say the battle for the eastern Ukraine city of Bakhmut is heating up again

title: French court to rule on the Macron retirement-age hike behind protests
description: The Constitutional Council will decide Friday whether to approve, tweak or reject the pension legislation increasing the minimum retirement age.

title: Russia trained Belarusian pilots in nuclear weapons use
description: Belarusian air force crews have completed their training in the use of tactical nuclear weapons as part of Russia’s plan to deploy the weapons to its ally Belarus amid the fighting in neighboring Ukraine

title: Populist Iraqi cleric announces suspension of his movement
description: Influential Iraqi Shiite cleric and political leader Muqtada al-Sadr says he will suspend the movement he leads for one year, citing “corruption” among some of his followers

title: Iranians mark Jerusalem Day to support Palestinians
description: Tens of thousands of Iranians have demonstrated in support of Palestians, marking the annual anti-Israel “Quds Day.”

title: Spanish climber leaves cave after 500 days in isolation
description: A Spanish mountain climber has emerged from a cave 70 meters (230 feet) underground after spending 500 days there isolated from the outside world

title: Populist Iraqi cleric announces suspension of his movement
description: Influential Iraqi Shiite cleric and political leader Muqtada al-Sadr says he will suspend the movement he leads for one year, citing “corruption” among some of his followers

title: 7.0 magnitude earthquake shakes Indonesia's main island
description: A strong earthquake has shaken parts of Indonesia’s main island of Java and tourist island of Bali, causing panic but there are no immediate reports of serious damage or casualties

title: Palestinian Authority blocks registration of legal aid group
description: The Palestinian Authority has blocked the registration of a legal advocacy group representing critics and opponents detained in Palestinian jails, a move condemned as the authority’s latest effort to stifle civil society in the occupied West Bank

title: 3 Alpine student guides killed in Italy avalanche
description: Rescue crews have recovered the bodies of three students training to be Alpine guides who were caught in an avalanche along Italy’s northwest border with France

title: Red Cross: Yemen rebels, Saudi coalition begin prisoner swap
description: An exchange of more than 800 prisoners from Yemen’s war held by the Houthi rebels and the Saudi-led coalition battling them has begun

title: Ukraine live briefing: China secretly agreed to provide weapons to Russia, documents show; suspected leaker arrested
description: A 21-year-old Massachusetts Air National Guard member is suspected of posting the material, which included grim assessments of the war among hundreds of secrets.

title: India’s population overtakes China’s, but numbers mask a bigger story
description: Within India, fertility rates diverge dramatically from state to state, reflecting a significant north-south divide.

title: Russia’s commando units gutted by Ukraine war, U.S. leak shows
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Russia’s clandestine spetsnaz forces have been put to use alongside the infantry, suffering massive numbers of dead and wounded.

title: Warsaw Ghetto uprising survivor honored on 80th anniversary
description: Tova Gutstein was 10 years old when the Jews of the Warsaw Ghetto launched an uprising against the Nazis

title: Shinkai sticking to what he knows best: Japan, youth, anime
description: Makoto Shinkai doesn’t yet know the story he will tell in his next film, only that it will be about what he knows best

title: The U.S.’s gloominess on the war in Ukraine is now clear to see
description: The apparent pessimism of U.S. officials about the course of the war underscores the question about what should come next.
